reviewText: This started off with alot of potential but quickly lost pace with its repetitivness and lack of depth, in many aspects it felt really bland and almost like it was not actually going anywhere. There was not enough depth in the whole story and felt confusing at times. With 6 possible outcomes, one might thing that this will have a good replay value but after the second play through its pretty obvious how to trigger each ending and  manged to do all 6 endings in a few a hours with the help of the skip buttton. Also dont worry too much about the nude aspect even with the patch its pretty tame. being a kickstarter backer i paid more than i should have for this game £30 to be excact and was it worth that? not in a million years. and backers didnt even get the OST. Is it worth its now price of £9.99. again nope. wait for sales on this one.

reviewText:
Enjoyable game;
As good as you would expect:
Graphics/Drawing,
Variety of scenes and characters,
Could be better
Pacing - Occassionaly got a little slow
Story could of had wider appeal (but may of lost the appeal to those would enjoy it, maybe watch a squirty play to find out?)
What was great:
Options - Story has a set of branches of which have smaller branches within, worth a second play at least.


What was the main problem
Playable character - felt some issue relating with the person I was playing, as I found him....a bit pathetic.

Story (no spoiler past first 20mins)
Awkward student who has distanced them self from everyone. Told to take on 2 clubs so you teacher can write you a better reference as it will prove your social skills". Upon picking your 2 clubs out of 3 you will meet a person of interest and have a story line added of interest
date: which run alongside the main trunk of story. Choose your responses and reactions to people you meet to carve your future. Will you be lucky in life? at your studies? at love? or can you master it all\n\nhttps://youtu.be/MvYLi0aB9oQ"
helpfulPercent: 22 of 34 people (65%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
A very enjoyable visual novel, with relatable characters.

In contrast to some of the Japanese style visual novels, it was much easier to relate to the characters in the game, including the sex scenes.

There are three main characters, with a small side character (the teacher), with a total of 6 endings giving a good amount of play time.

It is still a bit tricky/counter intuitive to achieve some of these endings, but one can always follow the community ending guide by Kei-chan.

If you're into that kind of thing, don't forget to apply the uncensor patch at http://dharkerstudio.com/updates.html (creating an account in the process).

Overall: 7.5/10

reviewText:
Club life more like School life! I thought we're going to be like clubbing and ♥♥♥♥ but instead we are actually joining some School clubs.. wow
Music sucks, sorry to say this but I'd rather play ''Emotiona Titanic Flute'' on the background than listen to this poop.
I mean if someone is SAD or DRAMATIC then can we have sad/dramatic music playing.. not happy or casual music -.-
During the winter we still swim outside? Wear light clothes? I mean I have nothing against some cleavage but during the winter when it's snowing people wear more clothes.. just saying
Janets story though.. is sad.
Got the sixth ending at first: No love no life
Kylies story is AWESOME
Melissa was in the end actually a good person.
CONCLUSION: I was at the start a little dissapointed but later I was happy that I purchased this game. It was definetly worth it!

reviewText: Club Life is an excellent short VN with three main routes and six endings to achieve. The art work is similar in style to Beach Bounce, which is great in my book. Each Girl has their own unquie personalities and the routes felt different enough to play through each one. My only real wish is that the game was longer to flesh out the story and characters far more. All in all however it was well worth picking up.\n\n6.5/10
